comments: One of those rare games that is not overly complex, but provides a challenging and fun gaming experience. It never seems to get old or boring.
author: Gamers' Temple

comments: Another glowing aspect of StarCraft is its absolutely brilliant Campaign Editor. This is the very best make-your-own game interface ever made.
author: Electric Playground

comments: The distinctive races, units, spell abilities, and bases are all unique and clever, so it's amazing that the game is as well balanced as it is. This is what gameplay is all about.
author: IGN

comments: If real aliens turn up while you are playing this, they donâ€™t stand a chance of getting your attention.
author: TotalGames.net

comments: The cinematic animations are outstanding, dramatic and funny. Even the voice-over acting is really good.
author: Gamezilla!

comments: Strong strategy, great graphics, and variety make this one of the year's best. [July 1998, p.114]
The game has so much life in it - whether in the great, narrative-driven single-player campaign or the multitude of multiplayer options - you won't grow tired of it anytime soon.
author: GameSpot

comments: You get a fun, instantly appealing, easy to play-hard to master real-time strategy, with character and an endless amount of playability.
author: Yahoo!

comments: It truly revolutionizes and sets a new standard for real-time strategy games on the PC.
author: All Game Guide

comments: Its well-developed plot, unique races, intuitive interface, and excellent campaign editor make it worth the price of admission, especially for those that liked "Warcraft II."
author: Computer Games Magazine

comments: By virtue of simple, solid gameplay, Starcraft has managed to rise above a predictable approach and been-there-done-that mechanics, and the final product (much like "Warcraft II" in 1995) seems fresh and new.
author: GamePro

comments: If you're looking for something new, if you're looking for groundbreaking gameplay, you won't find it here. What you will find is a very solid game engine, with fantastic multiplayer support, and nice units and technologies to choose from.
author: Happy Puppy

comments: While the game isn't necessarily revolutionary, it is refreshing in the gameplay it provides and the ability it gives players to create new challenges and prolong their gaming experience.
author: Adrenaline Vault

comments: It won't win any awards for originality, but it's good enough to shrink your nightly sleep to just a couple of hours.
author: Cincinnati Enquirer

comments: All in all, if you buy StarCraft, you're buying it for the multi-player. The single-player is just too short and disappointing...The game just doesn't live up to the lofty goals of its predecessors, and for that, it suffers.
author: Game Revolution
